description: President Donald Trump on Friday downplayed concerns about potential economic trouble, saying everything would be “OK” in the long term, even if the U.S economy experienced a recession in the short term.
title: Trump downplays recession fears, saying the U.S. would be 'OK' in the long term

description: A former senior cybersecurity official who refuted President Trump’s lies that the 2020 election was “rigged” is under federal investigation, a DHS spokesperson said.
title: Former aide who refuted Trump's false 2020 election claims is under federal investigation

description: The Trump administration has asked the Supreme Court to pause a lower court's order restricting affiliates of Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency from accessing sensitive Social Security Administration data, arguing in a Friday filing that the judicial order limits President Donald Trump’s executive authority.
title: Trump administration asks Supreme Court to grant DOGE access to Social Security data

description: The American Geophysical Union and American Meteorological Society announced an effort to support the congressionally mandated National Climate Assessment.
title: Private organizations step up to do science that was cut back by the Trump administration

description: President Trump might finally get his parade. The Army is planning a big celebration to recognize not only its 250th anniversary but also Trump’s 79th birthday.
title: U.S. Army is planning a parade for its anniversary — and Trump's birthday

description: The Trump administration agreed to halt all efforts to freeze funds intended for a Maine child nutrition program after initially suspending those dollars due to a disagreement between the state and Trump over trans athletes.
title: Trump administration settles with Maine over funding freeze after dispute over trans athletes

description: The New Jersey governor’s race could be President Donald Trump’s first chance, since returning to the White House, to sway a major GOP primary — and allegiance to Trump has become a top issue in the race.
title: Trump looms over New Jersey campaign as GOP looks to build on 2024 gains

description: Kohl’s CEO Ashley Buchanan was fired this week because he had an undisclosed personal relationship with a vendor on a consulting team that made a multimillion-dollar deal with the retailer at his direction, the company said in a regulatory filing.
title: Kohl's CEO fired for steering business to a  person with whom he had a relationship, retailer says

description: A law firm hired by Indiana University has concluded that former basketball team doctor Bradford Bomba Sr.
title: Doctor accused of abusing Indiana University athletes didn't act in 'bad faith,' law firm says

description: Former “Project Runway” production assistant Miriam Haley stormed out of a New York criminal courtroom Friday, moments after breaking down in tears and cursing on the stand during her fourth day at Harvey Weinstein’s sex crimes retrial.
title: Harvey Weinstein accuser Miriam Haley storms out of court after cursing at mogul's lawyer on stand

description: The White House on Friday released a budget blueprint that signals major shake-ups at NASA, as part of an effort to axe $163 billion in federal spending.
title: Proposed 2026 NASA budget slashes $6 billion, mostly from science programs

description: At 8:26 on the morning of Wednesday, January 8, a silver 53-foot, 18-wheeled horse transport van rolled up alongside Barn 59 at Santa Anita Park in Arcadia, California, seven miles due west of Pasadena and about 20 miles northwest of downtown Los Angeles, in the foothills of the San Gabriel mountains.
title: Four months after wildfires, Kentucky Derby favorite Journalism embodies symbol of resilience

description: The Trump administration has designated a coalition of Haitian gangs that have embroiled the Caribbean nation in mass violence as terrorist organizations, a White House official confirmed to NBC News.
title: State Department labels Haitian gangs as terrorist organizations

description: American Airlines’ new suites with sliding doors are set to start flying on some of its planes in June, a key part of its strategy to compete against more profitable rivals for high-spending customers.
title: American Airlines to debut new suites with sliding doors after delays

description: WASHINGTON — Some Senate Republicans are raising concerns about an exclusive dinner and White House tour President Donald Trump is offering top investors in his $TRUMP meme token.
title: Senate Republicans raise red flags about Trump's private dinner with his meme coin holders

description: Andy Le, now the sole survivor of his family and the brother of Katie Le, the 5-year-old who was killed in the Vancouver festival attack, is donating half the proceeds from his GoFundMe to other survivors and their families.
title: After Vancouver attack, family's 16-year-old sole survivor to give his donations to other victims

description: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos plans to sell up to 25 million shares in the company over the next year, according to a financial filing on Friday.
title: Jeff Bezos discloses plan to sell up to $4.8 billion in Amazon stock

description: Seven people were killed after a van and a truck collided on U.S.
title: 7 killed in Idaho after tour van and truck collide near Yellowstone

description: Netflix is on a winning streak.
title: Netflix stock is trading at all-time high levels in unprecedented win streak

description: President Donald Trump on Friday issued his latest call for the U.S.
title: Trump calls on Fed once again to lower rates after solid April jobs report

description: DETROIT — Automakers such as Ford Motor, Hyundai Motor and Kia on Thursday reported significant year-over-year U.S. sales increases in April as consumers rushed to purchase new vehicles ahead of potential price hikes due to tariffs.
title: Automakers report significant April sales increases amid tariff fear-buying

description: A 17-year-old boy is accused of helping start a massive wildfire in Ocean County, New Jersey, that burned thousands of acres and triggered the evacuations of 5,000, officials said.
title: 17-year-old charged with arson in connection with New Jersey wildfire

description: A new report sheds light on perceptions of Asians in the U.S.
title: Over 25% of people in the U.S. say Chinese Americans are a threat

description: More U.S. children have died this flu season than at any time since the swine flu pandemic 15 years ago, according to a federal report released Friday.
title: CDC reports 216 children died this flu season, the most in 15 years

description: Scientists say Tim Friede's blood could help them create a universal antivenom.
title: Snakes have bitten this man hundreds of times. His blood could help save lives.

description: Gregg Popovich will no longer coach the San Antonio Spurs and will transition to be the president of basketball operations, the team announced Friday.
title: Gregg Popovich steps down as coach of the Spurs

description: Ruth Buzzi, who rose to fame as the frumpy and bitter Gladys Ormphby on the groundbreaking sketch comedy series “Rowan & Martin’s Laugh-In” and made over 200 television appearances during a 45-year career, has died at age 88.
title: Ruth Buzzi, comedy sketch player on groundbreaking series ‘Laugh-In,’ dies at 88

description: Learn more ahead of the Kentucky Derby, including how to watch, what time it starts, what channels or streaming options are available, who is expected to win and more
title: Will this year’s Kentucky Derby end with another photo finish? Here’s what to watch

description: Laws that target packaging materials make the new paper-fiber product an eco-friendly solution for shipping refrigerated products.
title: 'RecyCoolers' could help reduce use of environmentally harmful Styrofoam packaging

description: An Ohio finance influencer is facing federal charges for allegedly running a "fraudulent real estate investment scheme," bilking investors out of over $11 million, according to a court document filed in U.S.
title: Finance influencer charged with running $11 million real estate fraud scheme

description: Blake Lively made an appearance on “Late Night With Seth Meyers” and spoke about the highs and lows she’d experienced amid the legal battle with Justin Baldoni.
title: Blake Lively said past year filled with 'lowest lows' of her life amid legal battle with Justin Baldoni

description: Halley’s comet swings near Earth every 75 years.
title: How to see Halley’s comet debris in the Eta Aquarid meteor shower

description: Voters in a part of South Texas that is home to Elon Musk’s rocket company SpaceX will decide Saturday whether to incorporate into a city named Starbase.
title: South Texans set a course for Musk’s Starbase

description: Prince Harry has XX won/lost XX his appeal against the U.K. government’s decision to axe his publicly-funded security detail at Britain’s High Court.
title: Prince Harry loses court battle over security protection despite stepping down as a full-time royal

description: A ship carrying aid heading for Gaza was attacked by drones in international waters off Malta early Friday, the group organizing the mission said.
title: Gaza activists say their aid vessel was hit by drones off the coast of Malta

description: Lawyers for Luigi Mangione, the man accused of killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in December, have filed a motion to dismiss the New York state murder charges against him, arguing that the case and federal charges against him mean he faces double jeopardy.
title: Luigi Mangione's legal team argues New York state case against him should be dropped

description: Actor Russell Brand was granted bail in his first London court hearing after he being charged with rape and sexual assault. Brand has denied the allegations. NBC News' Molly Hunter reports on when the British comedian is expected back in court.
title: Russell Brand granted bail during first rape and sexual assault court hearing

description: Marco Rubio’s swift rise in Trump's orbit. Uncertainty hits jobs growth. Steve Kornacki’s Kentucky Derby guide. "I Kissed a Girl" songwriter Jill Sobule dies.
title: Marco Rubio's expanded role and April jobs and unemployment report: Morning Rundown

description: Fans celebrating Liverpool’s record equaling 20th English Premier League soccer title, literally shook the earth.
title: Liverpool soccer fans literally shook the earth as they celebrated English Premier League title win

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order late Thursday to end public funding of National Public Radio and PBS to stop what he called "biased and partisan news coverage."
title: Trump signs executive order to stop federal funding for NPR and PBS

description: The election to replace Durbin as the Democratic whip won't happen until after the 2026 midterms, but Schatz is wasting little time.
title: Brian Schatz racks up support to succeed Dick Durbin as the No. 2 Senate Democrat

description: Iran has to “walk away” from uranium enrichment and long-range missile development and it should allow American inspectors of its facilities, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Thursday as a round of nuclear talks was postponed.
title: Iran must ‘walk away’ from all uranium enrichment, Rubio says

description: Steve Kornacki: This year's Kentucky Derby features a handicapping puzzle, with the possibility of a wild result and a nice payday for those who can figure it out.
title: Steve Kornacki’s guide to the Kentucky Derby: Biggest storylines, best bets

description: Sinatra Jordan spent 940 days in a Mississippi county jail waiting for a trial that would never come, even after the police who accused him were arrested.
title: A Mississippi man spent 940 days in jail waiting for a trial that never came

description: The latest development in the high-stakes battle between the administration and the legal community involves former Hunter Biden attorney Abbe Lowell.
title: Critics of law firms' deals with Trump are starting a firm of their own

description: Donald Trump has historically bad poll numbers for a president through the first 100 days in office, but the White House’s 2026 midterms strategy will run through Trump himself while trying to re-create the energy behind his 2024 campaign.
title: Inside the Trump White House's early 2026 midterm strategy

description: The pace of jobs growth in the United States most likely slowed in April as economic uncertainty ramped up.
title: Jobs growth likely slowed in April as economic uncertainty reigned

description: Marco Rubio was just two weeks into his new job when he got a critical lesson in being President Donald Trump’s secretary of state.
title: Marco Rubio's swift rise to a central spot in Trump's orbit

description: States are continuing to roll out their own versions of the Department of Government Efficiency, the outside advisory commission led by tech billionaire Elon Musk that President Donald Trump tasked with cutting federal spending and staffing.
title: State versions of DOGE take more modest approaches than Elon Musk's shock-and-awe moves in Washington

description: Israel attacked a target near the presidential palace in the Syrian capital Damascus, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, reiterating his vow to protect members of the Druze community.
title: Israel attacks target near Syrian presidential palace, Netanyahu says

description: Nearly four months after wildfires reduced thousands of Los Angeles-area homes to rubble and ash, some residents are starting to rebuild.
title: Los Angeles homeowners begin to rebuild after devastating wildfires

description: A veteran activist of the Civil Rights Movement said he was notified by the Smithsonian Institution that items he loaned to the National Museum of African American History and Culture may be returned, amid a potential review of the museum’s collections ordered by President Donald Trump.
title: Prominent pastor notified books loaned to African American museum may be returned amid review

description: President Donald Trump is at the center of a national election in Australia, where support for conservatives has dropped among voters angered by U.S. policies.
title: After Canada, Trump could drag down conservatives in another election in Australia

description: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson said Thursday that  attacks by President Donald Trump on judges were “not random” and seemed “designed to intimidate the judiciary.”
title: Justice Kentanji Brown Jackson criticizes Trump’s attacks on judges

description: The CIA on Thursday released two cinematic social media videos inviting disillusioned Chinese officials to spy for the United States.
title: CIA hopes cinematic videos will persuade Chinese to spy for U.S.

description: Singer Jill Sobule, known for the 1995 song “I Kissed a Girl,” died in a Minnesota house fire Thursday morning, her representatives said.
title: Singer Jill Sobule, known for 'I Kissed a Girl,' dies in house fire
